priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101847

self.title: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Code Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist to describe the test code for a physiological examination of the cardiovascular system.
name: Cardiovascular Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: The measure of an individual's cardiac output divided by the individual's body surface area (CI= CO/BSA).
The total volume of blood pumped by the heart over a set period of time, conventionally one minute; it is calculated as heart rate times stroke volume (CO= HR x SV).
The pattern of the epicardial vessels supplying the posterolateral and posterior descending coronary arteries.
The qualitative measurement of the severity of cardiac valvular regurgitation.
The qualitative measurement of the severity of cardiac valvular stenosis.
The percentage of myocardial tissue which exhibits characteristics of inadequate blood flow (ischemia).
The diameter across the left atrium measured at the end of systole.
The diameter across the ventricle at the end of diastole, excluding the thickness of the walls.
The diameter across the ventricle at the end of systole, excluding the thickness of the walls.

The percent or fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected in systole. The left ventricular ejection fraction is equal to the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.
Number of major epicardial vessels with greater than or equal to 70% reduction in diameter or greater than or equal to 50% reduction in cross-sectional area.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Diseased Coronary Artery Vessels

terms.definition: The resistance to blood flow through the pulmonary vasculature.
The resistance to blood flow through the systemic vasculature.
